result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa Ann Rile was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

With Huber/EMP
Consecutive to: Consecutive to 15CM508

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended; assessment through VA will be acceptable.

Defendant to undergo a domestic abuse assessment and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended.

Comply with any conditions, no contacts and assessments per agent.

Early termination after 12 months with agent's approval and agent deems it appropriate.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
